result.execSummary:
The defendant Alisha Raye Markley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court imposes sentence.

1:08 PM Defendant Alisha Raye Markley not in court.  Attorney Paul Douglas Polacek and Atty Reed Cornia in court for Alisha Raye Markley.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Cornia states DE is in inpatient treatment until 3pm today - matter is resolved - requests reset for plea/sent be set before 10/23 at the latest.  Atty Polacek is in agreement w/that.  State doesn't object but requests it be set off the 1pm calendar.  Court goes off the record to discuss scheduling.  All matters to track.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Absolute Sobriety; No possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx; No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  May not be at her employment any earlier than 15 minutes before or after her employment starts and begins at Trapper's Turn. Must submit to chemicall testing by LE.

3:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alisha Raye Markley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Alisha Raye Markley. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE does not qualify for PD appointment and DE intends to hire Atty Polacek.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State requests $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Dolch recommends a signature bond or $200 cash bond.  $1,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety.  No possession of  alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  May not be at her employment at  earlier than 15 minutes before or after her employment starts and begins at Trapper's Turn.  Must submit chemical testing by law enforcement.
